page.title: 01 A Gazeteer
page.content: Yardley Hastings lies on the A428 road 13 miles from Bedford and 8 miles from Northampton and is on the eastern border of Northamptonshire The village has around 700 inhabitants,and the cottages are built on either side of a small stream which flows alongside the main street and consequently the village has earned the nickname of "Little Venice".The name Yardley Hastings comes from the Saxon word "Yard",meaning a clearing in the woods and "ley",meaning a permanent pasture ground. Over the last few years small farms have been amalgamated to create viable units,and the majority of the land is used for arable farming. Close to the village is Yardley Chase, a large area of forest with a history stetching back to the Norman rule of England.
